meanings.sent1: His censurable behavior in class led to a stern talk with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The movie received censurable reviews for its poor acting and plot.
meanings.sent3: It was censurable how he kept interrupting the speaker with loud yawns.
meanings.sent4: The censurable state of the old building made it a safety hazard.
meanings.sent5: The censurable mistake cost the team the championship title.

meanings.definition: Able to be criticized or condemned.
meanings.sent1: The politician's censurable actions were exposed by the media.
meanings.sent2: The company's censurable policies led to a public outcry.
meanings.sent3: It was censurable how quickly the ice cream melted in the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: The censurable decision to cut down the ancient tree angered environmentalists.
meanings.sent5: The censurable behavior of the unruly crowd disrupted the peaceful protest.
